title: C00-2123

sentences.text: In this paper , we describe a search procedure for statistical machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- based on dynamic programming -LRB- DP -RRB- .

Starting from a DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem , we present a novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering between source and target language in order to achieve an efficient search algorithm .
A search restriction especially useful for the translation direction from German to English is presented .
The experimental tests are carried out on the Verbmobil task -LRB- German-English , 8000-word vocabulary -RRB- , which is a limited-domain spoken-language task .

summary: In this paper , we describe a search procedure for statistical machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- based on dynamic programming -LRB- DP -RRB- . Starting from a DP-based solution to the traveling salesman problem , we present a novel technique to restrict the possible word reordering between source and target language in order to achieve an efficient search algorithm . A search restriction especially useful for the translation direction from German to English is presented . The experimental tests are carried out on the Verbmobil task -LRB- German-English , 8000-word vocabulary -RRB- , which is a limited-domain spoken-language task .

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To describe a predicate means to convey or express information about something, typically providing an account of its characteristics, features, or nature. In this sense, it connects the subject (the entity being described) with the object (the aspect or attribute being described), offering insight into what makes that thing unique or notable.

Predicate-achieve.label: achieve
Predicate-achieve.description: To achieve means to successfully accomplish or attain something through effort and/or strategy. The predicate 'achieve' indicates that the subject has reached a desired state, outcome, or goal by employing a particular approach (object), which may involve overcoming challenges, making adjustments, or leveraging resources.

Predicate-is_presented.label: is presented
Predicate-is_presented.description: Indicates that a subject provides or offers an object as a representation, explanation, or demonstration. This predicate establishes a connection between the subject and object by highlighting the presentation of information from one to another.

Predicate-useful_for.label: useful for
Predicate-useful_for.description: The predicate 'useful for' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) serves as a means or tool that facilitates or enables the other entity (the object). In this context, the subject provides value or utility to achieve some goal or purpose defined by the object.

Predicate-carried_out_on.label: carried out on
Predicate-carried_out_on.description: Indicates that a specific action or process was performed with respect to a particular object or entity. The predicate 'carried out on' establishes a relationship between an activity (subject) and its target, focus, or subject matter (object).

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates a relationship where the subject relies on or uses as foundation, guidance, or inspiration the object. It suggests that the subject's existence, functionality, or validity are grounded in or derived from the characteristics, principles, or methods described by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject conceptually encompasses or generalizes the object. It implies a hierarchical relationship where the subject represents a more specific instance of the same category as represented by the object, which serves as its parent or superordinate.
